column4: I have a Gigabyte T1028 with an Atheros ar928x. It originally recognized the interface, but did not work properly (was unable to show available networks or even connect with a manually entered SSID). Then, I followed some instructions that involved downloading a driver, unpacking it, running a shell script and then running "sudo dpkg --install compat*deb" (I found this on the forum.) Unfortunately, now the interface doesn't come up at all. D
i already told you. if you don't see your card then you need to enable the module that will get your card working. it's like a driver, without, you'll get no where
Unfortunately, modprobing doesn't seem to help. It spews out in dmesg a bunch of commands (that sound alright to me) that aren't working. Things like "unknown symbol ieee80211_start_tx_ba_cb_irqsafe"
So I am stumped as to how to enable the module. Are you sure that ath9k is the right one?
